com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface restoreOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface restoreOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document restoreOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The restoreOrder API restores data that has been purged or archived from an order back to its regular tables.

    • Method Detail

      • restoreOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document restoreOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                  org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                           throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                  java.rmi.RemoteException
        The restoreOrder API restores data that has been purged or archived from an order back to its regular tables. In the normal completion of an order life cycle, the purge agent archives data into history tables. However, some situations require accessing data from an order after it has been archived. For example, a customer return may occur after that order has been purged or archived. This API can restore orders with multiple shipments or shipments with multiple orders.

        The restoreOrder API also restores YFS_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS records. For each status record where the status quantity is greater than zero, the pickup transaction from the pipeline is examined. If the pipeline works off the task queue, a request is created for the transaction with a data key which is the ORDER_HEADER_KEY value passed in the input xml. A pipeline transaction works off the task queue if the WORKS_OFF_TASK_Q column value is Y in the YFS_TRANSACTION table.

        While restoring an exchange order, the restoreOrder API will also restore the return order of the exchange order and the original sales order of the return order. The restoreOrder API restores all related work orders also.

        The API is not supported for Quotes.

        The restoreOrder API also deletes records from OSI_AWAITING_ARCHIVE table when integration with Order Archival Service is enabled and Order is restored.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetOrderExternallyUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        All order and shipment data directly or indirectly related to the order are made available in the regular tables. This includes data from orders with multiple shipments and data from shipments containing multiple orders.

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. Contains details of the order to be retrieved. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        Null.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
